{"step_by_step_thinking": "The perinatal mortality rate is defined as the number of deaths in the perinatal period (from conception to 28 days after birth) divided by a denominator. According to [Perinatal mortality at the gynecological hospital in Wels (author's transl)], the study from 1970 to 1976 reports on 14,033 children. Therefore, we can conclude that the denominator is Total bihs. This is because the number of total births is the most comprehensive and accurate way to calculate perinatal mortality rate.", "answer_choice": A}
